page.title: 19Wolfscote Grange.
page.content:
{Wolfscote Grange}was originally used by{monks.}The latest part of the house was built in{1649.
To avoid window tax many of the windows were blocked up. However, the present owners are in the process of {restoring the Grange}to its former glory, which includes unblocking the {stone-mullioned windows,}and exposing the{original oak lintels.
Because of its age and setting, and because there are no telegraph poles or electricity pylons to spoil the view, the{Grange is now used in {historical television productions.}For instance 'The Mallens'and 'All for Love'were both filmed at the Grange. It is also a working farm.
